gw.document

Class GosuCaseInsensitiveBackwardsCompatibleSymbolProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.document.SimpleSymbolProvider
      • gw.document.GosuCaseInsensitiveBackwardsCompatibleSymbolProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SymbolProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocumentCreationInfo

    public class GosuCaseInsensitiveBackwardsCompatibleSymbolProvider
extends SimpleSymbolProvider
    Simple symbol provider that accepts a Map A special variant of SimpleSymbolProvider that tries to maximize compatibility with references to symbols in sources that were written when Gosu was not case sensitive. Variable names in PCF files were often capitalized, e.g. "Variable" as opposed to "variable," yet the template descriptors often referred to the lowercase version in the requiredsymbols attribute and the ContextObject and FormField expressions.

    This symbol provider adds the variant of any symbol name automatically if it is not already in the table.

      Adds a simple symbol for the given name with the given value, deriving the type from the value, except a null value gets the type for Object and if the value is a Symbol, the type and value from that symbol are copied instead.
